alert.note: Alert for Hall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 11:30PM CDT until May 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Central and eastern Hall County. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated continuing moderate rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inch are possible over the area. This additional rain may result in the continuation of minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Memphis, Estelline, Lakeview and Plaska Community. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
